bibl.title: Demarco v. McKay. Memo from Judge
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In Justice Court Before A.E. Lawrence J.P. Tacoma 3d Ward Precinct Pierce County W.T.
Territory of Washington County of Pierce}ss
To the Sheriff or any constable of said county ordy Pierce Officer thereof.,

Whereas H.F. McKay has this day complained in writing under oath to the undersigned one of the justices of the Peace in and for said county that on the 25th day of December AD 1886 at the County of Cerllin in the state of Texas the defendant Frank Demarco did willfully, felonunly and of his malice of or thought with a clubbing a dangerous weapon which he then and there had and heed in his hands manfully, felownly and of his malice aforthought make an assault on one to him Doe whose other and true name is unknown, and him the said John Doe whose true name is unknown to complaint
